database_info.description: Complete comprehensive emotion database with 22 core emotions for advanced AI music generation
database_info.expansion_phase: FINAL - Complete emotion system with interpolation ready

Excitement.description: Using II7 chord creates expectant build-up fitting for excitement

Contentment.description: Simple major chords avoid strong cadences, producing soothing atmosphere

Melancholy.description: Rise from minor i to major III creates melancholic sound

Longing.description: Alternating minor and major chords yields bittersweet yearning

Malice.description: Dark, malevolent emotions with intent to harm or destroy

Cruelty.description: Built on the minor scale with a flattened second, the Neapolitan minor mode produces a uniquely haunting and unsettling dissonance. Using the ♭II (Neapolitan) chord as a predominant before a powerful V–i resolution creates a harsh, ominous atmosphere that evokes deliberate cruelty.

Sadism.description: Phrygian dominant features a major tonic with a flattened second, giving it a menacingly exotic sound. The I–♭II–I progression highlights the unnaturally close, dissonant semitone gap, creating a sense of evil glee and sadistic pleasure.

Vengefulness.description: The harmonic minor scale's raised 7th creates an intense pull to the tonic, fitting a vengeful drive toward resolution. The augmented mediant creates obsessive intensity, while the emphatic V–i cadence delivers decisive vindication.

Callousness.description: Locrian's defining diminished tonic and lack of true dominant make it inherently unstable and cold. The oscillation between ♭II and i° exploits Locrian's unresolved tension, creating an impression of emotional void and lack of empathy.

Manipulation.description: Employs a minor mode base but cleverly borrows chords to mislead the ear. The raised leading tone V followed by deceptive resolution to ♭VI creates musical trickery and cunning, capturing bait-and-switch progressions.

Domination.description: The double harmonic major scale contains both a ♭2 and ♭6, yielding an imperial, oppressive sound. The major I signifies authority and triumph, while sudden shifts to minor subdominant and Neapolitan chord inject fear and tension.

Narcissism.description: The double harmonic major scale is intensely exotic and dramatic with bold augmented seconds (♭2 and ♭6) creating regal yet unsettling sound, befitting grandiosity and menace of malignant narcissism. I–♭II progression introduces startling clash while V–I provides triumphant, authoritative cadence.

Machiavellianism.description: The diminished/octatonic scale produces creepy, tension-filled atmosphere well-suited to scheming and intrigue. Its symmetry and abundance of diminished chords create sense of constant calculation with no comfortable resolution, just as Machiavellian plot is always in motion.

Psychopathy.description: Locrian is most unstable and evil-sounding of modes. Its diminished tonic chord and lowered 5th refuse to provide resolution or warmth - fitting parallel to psychopath's moral void and lack of emotional center. Creates hollow, unnerving loop mirroring callousness and emptiness.

Spite.description: Hungarian minor has exaggerated, sharp-edged quality with two augmented seconds fitting spite's mix of bitterness and perversity. The raised 4th alongside minor third produces sneaky, piquant dissonance. Use of augmented chord highlights unnaturally heightened tension.

Hatred.description: Locrian's tonal instability with diminished tonic and flatted fifth effectively conveys seething animosity. Lack of perfect fifth means no musical rest, just as pure hatred offers no peace. Grotesque contrast of major chords that collapse back into diminished tonic.

Malicious_Envy.description: Neapolitan minor provides excellent analog to malicious envy's mix of yearning and ill-will. Contains tense half-step between 1–♭2 (resentment) alongside driving leading tone (desire/urgency). ♭II chord strikes with bold, jealous dissonance against minor tonic.

Contempt.description: Harmonic major has bright major I but introduces unexpected minor subdominant due to flattened 6th. This juxtaposition encapsulates condescension musically. Major chord asserts superiority while minor iv injects dark, disapproving tone - literally looking down with disdain.

Schadenfreude.description: Mixolydian mode being major but with lowered 7th conveys rowdy, sly cheerfulness - think mischievous grin. Upbeat, anthemic quality represents pleasure component, but ♭VII chord gives slightly off-kilter, less innocent tone hinting at moral twist.

Treachery.description: Whole tone scale's dreamlike, ambiguous quality is ideal for portraying deceit and unreality. Because all intervals are equal, it lacks tonal center - everything feels slippery. Cycling through augmented chords evokes illusive friendliness of traitor.

Ruthlessness.description: Harmonic minor's dramatic tension illustrates cold determination. Raised 7th in V chord creates forceful pull into resolution that feels like unrelenting drive. Leap from ♭VI down to dominant is stark and forceful, like ruthless decision cutting away warmth.

Wrath.description: Altered scale is most tension-saturated scale in music - essentially all wrong notes over dominant chord, creating maximum dissonance before resolution. Perfectly matches wrath: explosion of tension and anger that demands release. Cycling represents waves of fury.

Hostility.description: Phrygian dominant's inherent tension and fiery side illustrates constant aggression. Mode's clash of major I with ♭2 scale degree gives threatening, martial tone. Looping confrontation with semitone punch creates musical snarl, stuck in cycle of unresolved conflict.

Resentment.description: Natural minor mode well-suited to sustained negative emotion. Lack of raised 7th avoids strong forward motion, conveying stagnation of resentment - feeling stuck in bitterness. Classic lament bass descent associated with sorrow and bitterness over centuries.

Jealousy.description: Phrygian dominant instantly evokes fiery passion and turmoil - fitting for jealousy's volatile mix of love and hate. Andalusian cadence strongly associated with Spanish flamenco drama. Mode has swirling, feverish quality embodying obsessive emotion.

Misanthropy.description: Phrygian mode's gloomy, oppressive aura suits blanket disdain of misanthropy. Step from minor i to ♭II major is gut-punch of dissonance symbolizing disgust toward humanity. Music settles back into minor without leading tone - no uplift, confirming isolation and scorn.

Arousal.description: Instinctual activation and raw motivational drive states. Combines chromatic riffing with altered dominants to capture physiological emotional force.

Lust.description: Sensual desire with half-step tensions. Chromatic voice leading creates intimate harmonic friction.

progression_pool.description: Sultry minor progression with chromatic bass movement
Secondary dominant adds tension and release

Drive.description: Achievement motivation with dominant 7th energy. Persistent harmonic momentum.

progression_pool.description: Blues-influenced drive progression with dominant motion

Restlessness.description: Unstable harmonic movement with chromatic alterations suggesting constant motion.

Addiction.description: Repetitive, compulsive harmonic patterns that cycle without resolution.

progression_pool.description: Chromatic descent and return, like addiction cycle

Mania.description: Frenzied harmonic movement with unexpected key changes and rhythm acceleration.

progression_pool.description: Wildly unstable progression suggesting manic energy

Guilt.description: Internal moral conflict and self-reproach. Differs from shame by being private and sorrowful rather than public.

Remorse.description: Deep regret with Neapolitan chord overlay suggesting reflection on past actions.

Moral_Injury.description: Trauma from violating one's own values. Dissonant intervals suggest inner conflict.

Self_Reproach.description: Self-critical internal dialogue. Phrygian mode's ♭2 creates introspective character.

Ethical_Doubt.description: Uncertainty about moral choices. Harmonic ambiguity reflects ethical confusion.

Reverence.description: Awe directed toward something higher or sacred. Lydian's raised 4th creates transcendent quality.

Humility.description: Humble submission to higher power. Plagal cadences evoke sacred music traditions.

Worship.description: Active devotion and praise. Suspended chords create ethereal, worshipful atmosphere.

Faith.description: Trust in divine or transcendent. Dorian's balance suggests faith's complexity.

Sacred_Peace.description: Transcendent calm and spiritual serenity. Whole tone scales create otherworldly peace.

progression_pool.description: Whole tone derived progression creating sacred atmosphere

Wonder.description: Sustained fascination and exploration drive. Lydian Augmented's unique intervals suggest discovery.

Intrigue.description: Mysterious fascination with subtle chromatic movement suggesting hidden knowledge.

progression_pool.description: Chromatic passing tone creates mysterious intrigue

Exploration.description: Active discovery and adventure. Frequent modulations suggest exploring new territories.

progression_pool.description: Secondary dominant suggests exploring new keys

Marvel.description: Open-mouthed amazement with expansive harmonic intervals creating sense of vastness.

progression_pool.description: Extended chords create sense of marvel and wonder

Childlike_Wonder.description: Pure, innocent amazement with simple but magical harmonic progressions.

Dissociation.description: Emotional numbness and disconnection. Polytonal structures suggest detachment from reality.

Numbness.description: Complete emotional shutdown with static, unresolved harmonic clusters.

progression_pool.description: Static cluster chord representing emotional numbness

Alienation.description: Social and emotional isolation with conflicting key centers representing disconnection.

progression_pool.description: Tritone separated keys suggest complete alienation
Distant key centers express social isolation

Apathy.description: Lack of emotional engagement with slow, indifferent harmonic movement.

progression_pool.description: Static progression with minimal emotional engagement

Depersonalization.description: Loss of self-identity with incomplete, fragmented harmonic structures.

progression_pool.description: Same chord in different inversions suggests identity confusion

Empowerment.mode: Major with modal shifts and Sus4 builds
Empowerment.description: Positive self-realization and growth. Sus4 builds create sense of emerging strength.

Confidence.description: Self-assured strength with bold harmonic movement and strong root motion.

Inspiration.description: Uplifting creative energy with rising harmonic sequences suggesting aspiration.

progression_pool.description: Upward harmonic movement suggesting creative inspiration

Resilience.description: Strength through adversity with harmonic progressions that overcome difficulty.

progression_pool.description: Minor to major transformation showing resilience
Overcoming progression from minor to major

Liberation.description: Freedom from constraints with progressions that break expected patterns.

progression_pool.description: Breaking free from conventional progression order

Belonging.mode: Folk modal with simple shared rhythms
Belonging.description: Social cohesion and group harmony. Folk modes and simple rhythms suggest community.

Companionship.description: Close friendship and fellowship with harmonies that move together.

Unity.description: Group solidarity with harmonic unison and simple, shared progressions.

Acceptance.description: Being welcomed into community with gentle, accepting harmonic resolutions.

Loyalty.description: Steadfast devotion with stable harmonic progressions suggesting reliability.

Ideology.description: Purpose-driven conviction and belief-fueled passion. Modal mixture suggests complexity of belief.

Righteousness.description: Moral certainty and justified anger with powerful, decisive harmonic movement.

Conviction.description: Unshakeable belief with firm harmonic progressions showing resolve.

Zeal.description: Passionate dedication with energetic, intense harmonic movement.

Martyrdom.description: Self-sacrifice for cause with tragic yet elevated harmonic progressions.

Gratitude.description: Deep thankfulness and grace with warm, embracing harmonic progressions.

Thankfulness.description: Heartfelt appreciation with rich, warm harmonic extensions.

Forgiveness.description: Release of resentment with gentle, forgiving harmonic resolutions.

Closure.description: Peaceful completion and acceptance with harmonically complete progressions.

Peaceful_Reflection.description: Contemplative serenity with suspended harmonies slowly resolving.
